Details: 2017 Peshawar Agriculture Directorate attack: On 1st December 2017 Friday morning 3-4 gunmen who were burqa-clad, arrived at the Agriculture Training Institute in a rickshaw. 9 people were killed and 37 were injured. Three attackers were also killed.[1][2][3]
Two Somali soldiers and 12 militants were killed when al-Shabab militants attacked a convoy.[4]
At least one civilian was killed and eleven others were injured in a serie of bombings in southern Baghdad. Another bomb went off in a road next to the capital.[5]
Fifteen persons were killed and 53 others injured in twin suicide bomb attacks in a market in Borno State.[6]
25 people were killed when a house rigged with explosives blew up in Rawa.[7]
Three Afghan security officers were killed and 10 other people were injured in three rocket and bomb attacks in Jalalabad.[8]
At least six civilians, including a woman and a child, were killed and 13 others wounded in a blast in Jalalabad.[9]
One person was killed while five others were injured in two bomb blasts in northern and eastern Baghdad.[10]
11 persons including Nepali Congress youth leader Gagan Thapa have been injured in an explosion targeting his election rally at Chapali.[11]
Two civilians were killed and another seven were wounded when militant missiles hit the Al-Abassiyeen Bus Station in Damascus.[12]
A UN police officer from Mauritania was killed and three others injured in a shooting attack in Bria by Anti-balaka militants.[13]
A soldier was killed after militants attacked an army patrol in Qazigund area of south Kashmir. The two attackers were killed by the security forces.[14]
A bomb blast killed 8 people and injured 16 others on a bus in Syria's Homs city.[15]
Two persons were killed and another injured in two explosions in Baghdad.[16]
Six civilians were killed and nine others were injured in an attack carried out by a suicide bomber in Mir Ali. The target of the attack was a security convoy.[17]
Five people were killed and four others kidnapped in an armed attack in southwest Kirkuk. Furthermore, a policeman was killed in a drive-by shooting in Kirkuk city.[18][19]
A Muslim man was burned alive by a Hindu extremist in Rajasthan, India. The attacker has released a video of the act.[20]
One Ukrainian serviceman was killed and another wounded by shelling at Avdiivka. In addition one Ukrainian soldier was wounded and another was injured by explosion of a booby trap.[21]
One Iraqi was killed and another one was wounded when armed gunmen shot at them in northern Baghdad.[22]

A man carrying a Palestinian flag attacked a Jewish restaurant in Amsterdam with a club while shouting 'Allahu akbar'. There were no injuries in the attack, but the restaurant's windows were destroyed, as two police officers looked on without intervening.[23] The attacker, a 29-year-old Syrian, was released by Dutch authorities on December 20, despite evidence that the man had acted as a trained combatant in Syria's civil war, and despite his claims that he would again resort to violence if sufficiently angered, and despite his statement to the Dutch court that his attack on the restaurant was “only the first step.” [24]

One Ukrainian military officer was killed and three others wounded in the Donetsk Oblast at noon. Later in the evening four Ukrainian soldiers were killed (at Vodiane, Kamianka, and Travneve), and two soldiers were wounded.[25]
Five civilians were wounded in a bomb blast in the south of Baghdad.[26]
An army officer was killed, while two other soldiers were wounded as a booby-trapped house exploded in western Anbar.[27]

Location: North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo
Details: At least 14 UN peacekeepers were killed and 53 wounded in an attack in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo. Five soldiers were also killed during the attack. The attack was described as the worst on UN peacekeepers in recent history.[28]
An explosion inside a mosque in Nangarhar province, the east of Afghanistan, left one dead and at least eight others wounded.[29]
Four police officers were killed in a bomb blast in southern Mosul.[30]

Three rockets were fired from Gaza to Israel during the Palestine clashes for the recognition of Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. One of the projectiles landed in Sderot and injured two people. The other two projectiles exploded in the sky. Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades claimed the incident.[31][32]
A car parked in central Tikrit exploded, killing two and injuring two others. A number of shops were damaged in the bombing.[33]
At least seven people were killed in a encounter between FARC dissidents and other gruops un The zone [34][35]
Four Ukranian soldiers were killed and another injured in a series of attacks by Pro-Russian Separatists, in the east of the country. A civilian was also killed during the attack.[36][37]
Several explosions hit different places in Baghdad. Loyalists of the Iraqi regime are suspected behind the attacks.[38][39]
Perpetrator: Supreme Command for Jihad and Liberation (suspected)

Details: Two bomb blasts in Ramadi killed at least four people. Islamic State is behind the attacks.[40][41]

Several people launched burning objects against a synagogue in the center of Gothenburg. No injuries were reported. Three men, two of whom were from Syria and the State of Palestine, were arrested in connection with the attack.[42][43]
A security guard was seriously injured after being stabbed in the chest at the entrance to Jerusalem's central bus station.[44]
Two civilians and the bomber were killed when suicide bombing attacked a mosque after morning prayers in far northern Cameroon.[45]
Swedish police found two firebombs at a jewish chapel in Möllevången district, in the city of Malmö.[46]

Type: Attempted suicide attack (pipe bomb partially detonated)
Details: 2017 Port Authority Bus Terminal explosion: A 27-year-old Bangladeshi national who lived in Brooklyn, is suspected of setting off a home-made pipe bomb at the port authority, in Manhattan. Later he told police his motive was recent Israeli actions in Gaza and that was inspired by the Islamic State.[47]
A car bombing killed a Somalian journalist in Mogadishu.[48]
Two people (A father and son) were shot dead by ULFA militants.[49]
Two Iraqi policemen were wounded when an explosive device went off in northwestern Mosul.[50]
Five people were killed by Boko Haram militants in Damboa, Nigeria.[51]
Two police officers were hurt in a grenade attack in the city of Mixto. Police is investigating the incident as a narcoterrorist attack.[52]
A militant were killed in an encounter between militants of NDFB-S and security forces.[53]
18 police officers were killed and 20 others were injured when a suicide bomber disguised as a policeman blew himself up inside a police training camp in Somalia's capital Mogadishu.[54][55]
At least 14 security force members were killed in a shooting against Taliban militants in Helmand province, during a mission.[56]
A bomb placed in northern Baghdad killed at least a civilian and injured five others.[57]
An Iraqi farmer was injured in a roadside bomb attack in Diyala Governorate.[58]
An Israeli Border Police officer was moderately wounded Friday after being stabbed by a Palestinian in the West Bank city of Ramallah.[59]
A suicide bombing launched against a group of militar brigades killed at least two security forces and injured six others.[60]

Two Danes working for National Geographic were injured, one seriously, in a stabbing attack by a radical Nigerian Islamist in a tourist zone in Libreville. The attacker was inspired by \US attacks against Muslims and America's recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital\".[61][62]"
An encounter between ELN and FARC dissidents kills at leats two civilians in The departemt of Nariño.[63]

2017 Quetta church attack: At least nine people, including two women, were killed and 57 sustained injuries when suicide bombers attacked Bethel Memorial Methodist Church located on Quetta’s Zarghoon Road.[64]
A Palestinian armed with explosives was arrested outside West Bank military court. A second pipe bomb was found in the suspect's jacket.[65]
At least one woman was killed and five other civilians were wounded in a suicide attack on a convoy of foreign troops in Kandahar province.[66]
Three federal police forces were killed in a shootout with Islamic State west of Mosul.[67]
Gunmen shot and killed the Mayor of Misurata, Libya, Mohamed Eshtewi, as they were chasing down his car.[68]
Three Ukrainian soldiers were killed in the Donbass region, and none were reported injured. Russian Separatist forces are suspected to be behind the attack.[69]
Gunmen attack a training center of the National Directorate of Security in Kabul.[70]
A UN peacekeeper from Guinea died in an attack in northeastern Mali.[71]
Two people have been killed and at least 31 others wounded in a car-bomb attack targeting a convoy of security forces in the capital of southern Helmand province.[72]
A military officer was killed and two others wounded after a mortar shell fell on a military airport near Arish, in North Sinai Governorate.[73]
Two civilians and a tribal fighter were injured in two bomb blasts in Baghdad.[74]
A bomb exploded outside one of Greece's main courthouses in Athens, police had cleared the area and nobody was hurt.[75]
Four persons were wounded as a bomb blast took place in south of Baghdad.[76]
At least six police force members were killed in a suicide car bombing attack next to a police headquarters in Kandahar province.[77]

A string of shootings began just steps from the state's Capitol building when El-Mofty fired several times at a Capitol Police officer and then, shot and injured a state trooper. Later, he used two handguns to open fire at several officers who then returned fire and killed him.[78]
Three people were killed in two attacks in northern Cameroon by Boko Haram militants.[79]
Gunmen open fire in a café in the south of Cairo killing at least three people and injuring five others. The attackers are suspected to be Islamic State terrorists.[80]
At least seven civlians were killed and three others were wounded in an IED explosion in Helmand province.[81]
A civilian was killed and five others injured after a bomb explosion in a market in southern Baghdad.[82]
Three security officers were killed in an IED explosion in northern Pakistan.[83]
Four personnel of the pro-government paramilitary troops and three Islamic State militants were killed in a shooting attack.[84]
A soldier was killed and two others injured when a bomb was went off in Hakkâri Province, southern Turkey.[85]

Six tribal fighters were killed in confrontations with Islamic State militants in west of Kirkuk. In a related attack at least four people, including a senior tribesman and police department chief, were killed in two armed attacks.[86][87]
Ten people have been killed and five injured in a suicide bomb attack near the compound of Afghanistan's intelligence agency in Kabul.[88]
Four policemen were killed during a shooting against Islamic State terrorists in the west of Mosul.[89]
At least four marines were wounded when a explosive charge explode near an army convoy.[90].
An explosive charge went off while an army patrol was passing in Hawija, leaving two soldiers dead and an officer injured.[91]

One army soldier and an assailant were killed and 14 soldiers were wounded when a suicide car bomb struck an army convoy near a police station in Lashkargah, capital of southern province of Helmand.[92]
At least 14 people were injured in a homemade bomb which exploded in a storage locker at a St. Petersburg supermarket.[93][94][95]

December 2017 Kabul suicide bombing: A suicide bomber stormed a Shi‘ite cultural center and news agency in the Afghan capital , killing 41 people and wounding scores, many of them students attending a conference. Two other bombs were detonated in the zone.[96]
An explosion caused by a bomb hit a Turkish police station in Adana.[97]
A suicide bombing caused by a Boko Haram militant in Borno State killed at least six people and injured 13 others.[98]

Two persons, a police officer and a civilian, were killed during a shooting in a bank. After that, six Egyptian security personnel were killed when a roadside bomb exploded during a terrorist raid.[99]

2017 Saint Menas church attack: Eleven people have died in twin attacks on Coptic Christians in the southern Cairo: eight civilians and a police officer were killed in a shooting outside a church, and two civilians were killed in a Coptic-owned shop beforehand. One attacker was killed by the police.[100][101]
A tribal figure was killed in an attack by Islamic State against a village in northeastern Diyala.[102]
43 people were injured when two attackers threw a grenade in a night club in northern Colombia.[103]
